p: During the first 3 to 6 months of life, maternal nAbs protect neonates against infection. While maternal nAbs protect against disease related to most PeV-A genotypes, PeV-A3 is again an exception. Severely ill neonates lacked maternal nAbs against PeV-A3 at the onset of a disease and mothers from neonates with PeV-A3 infections showed no or low a-PeV-A3 Ab titers [ 129, 130].
